attributes.action: Give young people with a negative test the same rights as a vaccine passport
attributes.additional_details:
We may not be able to stop proof of an NHS vaccine (i.e. a ‘passport’ or ‘certificate’) being used to give vaccinated people greater freedoms, e.g. to travel internationally, or to attend events in the UK.

However, until everyone has been offered a vaccine, this will give the old an unfair advantage over the young. 

As a temporary measure, legislation must be introduced giving (young) people with a negative covid test the same rights as (old) people who have been vaccinated.
attributes.background:
The government should legislate that a negative covid test must provide equal rights to a vaccine. 

This should be accompanied by free covid tests for adults that have not been offered a vaccine.
